definition: to win a prize/a successful gamble
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: Or do I need a competition game plan?
sentences.chinese: 或者我需要計劃一下中獎的“大業”嗎？

sentences.english: Don't send eInvoice to me. We will send eInvoice to you if the invoice wins a prize.
sentences.chinese: 電子發票不用寄給我，請代管，如中獎才寄給我。

sentences.english: and I don't think I really will win, but sometimes it's fun to play anyway.
sentences.chinese: 我從未覺得我會中獎，可是有時就覺得很好玩。

sentences.english: Odds of winning depend on number of eligible entries received.
sentences.chinese: 中獎率取決於我們收到的有效的申請數目。

sentences.english: All tickets will be subject to the Magnum 4D's normal prize structure.
sentences.chinese: 所有中獎彩票的派彩額，根據現有的彩金架構。

sentences.english: You pray at temples for a winning lottery number.
sentences.chinese: 在寺廟裏祈求樂透中獎號碼。

sentences.english: If the mine goes off, we will win the awards-micro-point software.
sentences.chinese: 如果地雷爆炸，我們就會中獎，贏得微點軟件。

sentences.english: IV. Winning the bet from time to time multiple lightning turn 2 or 3 times.
sentences.chinese: 中獎之押注倍數不定時閃電翻2倍或3倍。

sentences.english: The numbers was chosen by machine live on television.
sentences.chinese: 彩票中獎號碼由機器在電視現場直播選出。

sentences.english: The winner from an impressive number of entrants was Andy Jones from Crawley , congratulations to him.
sentences.chinese: 最後中獎者是來自克老雷的安迪瓊斯，祝賀他。

sentences.english: People who play regularly know whether they win regularly.
sentences.chinese: 那些經常買彩票的人知道他們是否經常中獎。

sentences.english: Lao Xiao cannot bear curiously, the click enters draws a prizewinning ticket the page, as soon as looked, felt relieved.
sentences.chinese: 老肖忍不住好奇，點擊進入中獎頁面，一看，放心了。

sentences.english: My number came and I won 100.
sentences.chinese: 我賭她字呈票中獎了，斡贏睹100英鎊。

sentences.english: IF I were a prophet , I would tell you the lottery number.
sentences.chinese: 如果我是先知的話，我會告訴你彩票的中獎號碼。

sentences.english: It's kind of like finding a winning lottery ticket in the cushions of your couch.
sentences.chinese: 就像在沙發墊裏發現一張中獎的彩票一樣。

definition: to draw a prize/a lottery/a raffle
just in case/if by any chance/contingency
to sign up/to enter one's name/to apply/to register/to enroll/to enlist
weight/number/code/to pile/to stack/classifier for length or distance (yard), happenings etc
verification code/CAPTCHA, a type of challenge-response test (computing)
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
